author: Global Times
title: China’s private Caixin PMI in December hits 50.8, highest in four months - Global Times
text:
Workers check lithium battery manufacturing parts at a local factory in Wuxi city, East China's Jiangsu Province on January 14, 2022. Photo: VCG
China’s private Caixin Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) set a new high in four months to 50.8 in December 2023, indicating a sustained recovery in the nation’s medium- and small-sized manufacturers.
The figure edged up 0.1 points from the previous month and remained in the expansion territory for the fourth time in the past five months, according to Wang Zhe, senior economist at Caixin Insight Group.
The report noted that the manufacturers saw stronger increase in output and new market orders. The increase in overall sales in December was the quickest recorded since February 2023, while improved market conditions and great client spending had supported the latest rise in new production, read the report.
The downturn in new foreign sales also moderated in December, with new export business declining at a marginal rate that was the weakest in six months.
Both supply and demand expanded as the market maintained an upward trend, boosting production and sales, the report said. The sub-indexes for output reached a new high since May and total new orders also recorded a new high since February 2023, with particularly strong demand for consumer goods.
Wang said that the economic outlook for the manufacturing sector continued to improve in December, with supply and demand expanding and price levels remaining largely stable.
However, some challenges still remain.
Wang said that employment remained a significant challenge, while business remained cautious in areas including hiring, raw material purchasing and inventory management.
Looking ahead, Wang pointed out that there is still room for adjustments in fiscal and monetary policies, while calling for strengthened efforts in increasing employment to ultimately foster long-term market confidence.
China’s official manufacturing PMI in December edged down from 49.4 in November to 49 in December, remaining in contraction territory, according to data from the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) on Sunday.
China’s manufacturing PMI drops to 49 in Dec; policies expected to boost demand 2023/12/31 12:49:54
The slight drop of manufacturing PMI was affected by factors such as off-season production for several categories of basic raw material industries, indicating a slight decline in the level of economic activity, according to Zhao Qinghe, an NBS official.
China's manufacturing sector ranked among top tier in the world during the 2020-22 period, showing both resilience and stable growth, according to the 2023 China Manufacturing Power Development Index Report, released by the Chinese Academy of Engineering on Thursday.
China’s manufacturing development ranks among world’s best, with key industries set to lead global development: report 2023/12/28 19:55:40
Global Times

author: latercera.com
title: Habla Miguel Piñera tras revelarse diagnóstico de leucemia - La Tercera
text:
Rodrigo Gómez S. hace 12 minutos Tiempo de lectura: 4 minutos Miguel "Negro" Piñera El músico se refirió a su enfermedad, la cual le fue diagnosticada "hace un tiempo". Afirma que no quería contarlo, pero que finalmente se terminó filtrando desde la clínica.
compartir Comentarios El cantante Miguel Piñera , más conocido como el “Negro”, conversó respecto a su estado de salud, luego de que esta jornada se conociera que padece de una leucemia aguda y que su pronóstico de vida se extiende por seis meses.
El hermano menor del fallecido expresidente Sebastián Piñera dio a conocer su diagnóstico en una entrevista televisiva del programa Primer Plano de Chilevisión que, durante esta jornada, entregó un adelanto del espacio, que será emitido el próximo domingo, en que el artista reconoció que sus doctores le afirmaron que le quedan “seis meses de vida”.
De forma paralela al adelanto del programa de farándula, trascendió que Miguel Piñera fue internado esta tarde, en una clínica del sector oriente. En ese contexto y mientras recibía atención médica, el “Negro” Piñera concedió una entrevista al programa Que te lo digo , donde abordó su estado de salud y la sensación que tiene tras difundirse su enfermedad.
“Arriba los corazones, yo ya he vivido más de siete vidas. Ya está”, partió diciendo el menor de los Piñera Echenique. “Yo estoy la raja (sic), si los que quedan mal son los parientes, los amigos. Yo estoy bien” , recalcó.
“Esto ya me lo habían contado hace tiempo, no había querido contarlo. Se filtró de la clínica, como es mucha la gente que sabe, entre enfermeras, ayudantes, asesores, se filtró. No quería contarlo, no quería hablar, la verdad. Quería estar solito, tranquilito, pero ya llegó un momento en que ya no hallaba cómo taparlo”, reveló el cantante.
“Estoy agradecido de Dios, de la vida, agradecido de todo mi Chile lindo y querido, porque la verdad es que tuve la oportunidad de, por lo menos, enterrar a mi hermano querido (Sebastián Piñera), que ahora se cumple un año (de su fallecimiento)”, agregó.
En esa línea, relató el “orgullo” que significó para él participar de un funeral de Estado, en que se honró al expresidente Piñera. Asimismo, señaló que desde entonces ha actuado en al menos 100 oportunidades realizando sus presentaciones artísticas, donde realiza un “homenaje” a su fallecido hermano, a quien calificó como “un padre para mí”.
La historia continua más abajo
Más sobre Magazine “Te quedan seis meses”: Miguel Piñera revela en entrevista que sufre de leucemia aguda Hace 5 horas Iñaki Vicente, director ejecutivo de CHV, y el Unplugged de Los Bunkers: “Tenemos ganas de seguir explorando esta veta” Hace 8 horas “¿Así que, qué más? Ahora tengo seis meses más para despedirme de mis amigos, de mi Chile lindo y querido . Voy a seguir cantando, estoy con el ánimo arriba, así que arriba los corazones, no tengan pena”, agregó.
Respecto a la cobertura que ha tenido su enfermedad, sostuvo que “me da pudor”.
“Yo creo que esto es algo que, obvio, algo influyó la muerte de mi hermano, porque me dolió mucho y fue muy duro. Me fue afectando (...) Mi hermanito me va a cuidar allá arriba , voy a llevar la guitarra, vamos a hacer una fiesta arriba o abajo, puede ser en el infierno también”, complementó el empresario del sector bohemio.
Asimismo, Miguel Piñera entregó una reflexión al programa Hay que decirlo, de Canal 13 , donde el panelista Willy Sabor leyó un mensaje enviado por el músico. “En estos momentos, cuando miro la vida recorrida, me es imposible no sentirme agradecido por tantas personas e historias maravillosas que la vida me ha dado la oportunidad de conocer”, declaró.
“He podido recorrer este Chile maravilloso en distintos momentos de su historia; lo he visto reír y también llorar, caerse y levantarse una y otra vez. Es así el espíritu de mi gente linda, un Chile luchador y rebelde con un corazón enorme”, dijo Piñera.
“He tenido una vida plena con la alegría y los dolores que todas las personas debemos enfrentar . La oportunidad de caminar la vereda del músico, donde uno puede alegrar los corazones de los demás, sacarlos del cansancio, del estrés, darles una terapia de buen ánimo y energía”, añadió.
“Las últimas épocas han despedido a mi querida hermana Guadalupe y este año al inalcanzable Sebastián, a quien muchos extrañan . Durante el año anuncié mi gira de despedida, recorriendo más de 60 escenarios a lo largo y ancho de mi querido Chile, recibiendo un lindo reconocimiento a mi humilde legado y también acompañándome en la tristeza de los hermanos que partieron”, comentó el “Negro” Piñera.

author: MasterChof
title: #25 Israel vuelve a masacrar en el mismo punto a docenas de palestinos que estaban esperando el reparto de ayuda humanitaria [EN]
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#5](c5#c-5) es lógico: cuando a un asesino en serie no se le para los pies ¿por qué iba a dejar de cometer crímenes? Con los sionistas, mas bien ocurre lo contrario: les dan palmaditas en la espalda.
[#17](c17#c-17) una pregunta difícil de responder... aunque es posible que sea peor el que lo arma y le abre la puerta, puesto que de una bestia, nada bueno se espera.
[#0](c0#c-0) "Dozens of Palestinians reportedly killed" ¿asesinados por quién, CNN? (si cambiamos la N central por una "O", se pronunciaría "Si On"
[#23](c23#c-23) en cambio, sí que dieron cobertura a full a todos los mentirosos israelíes que "vieron con sus propios ojos los bebés decapitados", "horneados", "las violaciones en masa" e incluso "las violaciones de cadáveres perpetradas por Hamas".
Ahí ni comillas ni elusión de los responsables...
Aquí aún podemos ver los bulos soltados en su momento:
Los supervivientes del 'holocausto' de Hamás en la Eurocámara: "Europa peligra, es el mal absoluto"

[#11](c11#c-11) a Japón le tiraron las bombas no por Japón, sino por Rusia.
Mismo motivo por el que ahora no veremos el uso de armamento nuclear, espero.

author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: Dakar Moto, Stage 12: Ricky Brabec returns to success in the Dakar Rally | FormulaPassion.it - Pledge Times
text: It's a party for Brabec Recovering a ten-minute gap in the last stage of the 2024 Dakar Rally, in a total distance of 328 km from Al Ula to Yanbu, would have been a real feat for Ross Branch, who however produced an edition that was anything but disappointing . And in fact, for the Botswana-born pilot the goal was not achieved. In this way, Ricky Brabec can thus officially rejoice for the victory achieved in Saudi Arabia, the second in his career. Honda also returns to success For Branch there is the consolation of an excellent 2nd place on his Hero after a long battle with his rival, all while the Honda can enjoy the first success since 2021. On that occasion it was Kevin Benavides to bring the Japanese company to the top step of the podium, with the Argentinian winning the 12th and final race on the program today, distancing Toby Price and his brother Luciano by exactly one minute, the latter 14 seconds behind the KTM. A stage victory which also allows the Argentine to overtake Cornejo Florimo in the standings, finishing in fourth position ahead of Price. For his part, Brabec managed his lead by finishing in seventh place, almost 30 seconds ahead of Branch, ninth. A gap which therefore allowed the 32-year-old to be able to finish on a high note without taking excessive risks, reliving the emotions experienced in the 2020. In fact, that season he won his first Dakar (the first in Saudi Arabia), becoming Honda's hero at the same time. Thanks to the American's feat, Minato's company returned to victory for the first time since 1982. Furthermore, Honda can also rejoice for the presence on the podium of Adrien van Beveren, who had not particularly shone in the first stages but recovered in the second half of this edition, with some stage victories that took him up to third position. Among Italians it is worth highlighting the 47th place for Gioele Meonieven if the biggest regret remains in the retirement of Paolo Lucci during the seventh stage, when the blue voluntarily ended the test due to a physical problem. Unfortunately, this edition also saw the tragic death of Carles Falconwho died a few days after the fall in the second stage. author: @kwqcnews
title: Student Hunger Drive collects donations for 787,186 meals
text: DAVENPORT, Iowa (KWQC) - Quad City area students collect enough donations for 787,186 meals as part of the 38th Student Hunger Drive, which ended Thursday night. Sixteen Quad Cities area high schools participated in the food and funds drive, which started in September. Students from competing schools planned, executed and set goals to be named the top fundraisers in their division. Lexie Thomsen, a senior at Orion High School, said her school got a lot of donations from their community, including 1,000 cereal boxes. “It made me feel really happy that, like all the community’s thinking of us and thinking that we donate here and we help everybody in need.” Thomsen said. During the drive, students learn about volunteering and organization as they work with neighborhood elementary and middle schools. Harper Miller, a sophomore at Assumption High School, said she was blown away from the overwhelming response from the community and students. “The support that people gave, and the students were just so motivated to win and to do well, and they brought in so much food,” Miller said. “They went to the store and bought food, and all of our feeder schools also brought in a lot of food.” The rally started at 5:30 p.m. at River Bend Food Bank. Before the rally began, the students deliver the donations to the food bank. In 2023 the Student Hunger Drive brought in 818,468 meals, exceeding 2022’s record of 817,038 meals. The winners were: Division C - 1st place: Rivermont Collegiate - 2nd place: Morning Star Academy Division B - 1st place: Alleman High School - 2nd Orion High School Division A - 1st place: Pleasant Valley High School - 2nd place: Bettendorf High School Pleasant Valley also won the Mission Challenge Award while North Scott High School won Most Improved. Moline High School was the Skit Winner. Copyright 2024 KWQC. All rights reserved.

author: Bernardo Scotti
title: El fútbol argentino se vuelve tendencia mundial por esta bestial batalla campal
text: El fútbol argentino quedó en la mira del mundo por este lamentable episodio que ocurrió en el partido entre Gimnasia y Barracas Central por la Copa Argentina, que acabó con trompadas, empujones y golpes entre jugadores, ayudantes y más personas que entraron al campo de juego. El duelo, que se jugó en el Estadio Ciudad de Lanús, terminó siendo noticia mundial, pero no por el resultado. Aunque el Lobo se llevó la victoria por 1-0 y avanzó a los cuartos de final de la Copa Argentina, lo que realmente captó la atención fue el caos que se desató al final del partido. ¿Por qué se produjo la batalla campal en la Copa Argentina? El caos se desató tras el pitazo final del árbitro Darío Herrera, quien había expulsado a Juan Cortazzo de Gimnasia sobre la hora. Lo que siguió fue una chispa que encendió la mecha de la batalla campal. Todo comenzó con un intercambio de palabras entre Leonardo Morales, defensor del Lobo, y Jhonatan Candia de Barracas Central. En cuestión de segundos, la situación se intensificó cuando Yonathan Cabral y Gustavo Canto, también de Gimnasia, se sumaron a la discusión. Lo que parecía ser una simple confrontación verbal rápidamente escaló a un nivel físico. Las tensiones se dispararon, y en un abrir y cerrar de ojos, la cancha se convirtió en un campo de batalla, con jugadores lanzando patadas y golpes por doquier. La pelea no solo involucró a los protagonistas iniciales, sino que se extendió a otros jugadores, transformando el final del partido en un espectáculo lamentable que dejó una huella negativa en la Copa Argentina.

author: Robesonian
title: Mobile-home mogul Marty Wright expects big things in Lumberton
text:
‘We’re killing it,’ he says of his new location in Robeson County
LUMBERTON – Roughly two weeks ago, Marty Wright opened up his seventh mobile home business, this time in Lumberton.
Marty Wright Home Sales is located at 1140 N. Roberts Ave., which used to be home to the Rowan Mobile Home Park.
The 55-year-old Wright, who was born in Anderson, South Carolina, and attended Orrum High School for three years before his 1986 graduation, appears to have a real knack for selling mobile homes.
That goes for his eight-person Lumberton staff, too, with quite a few having worked for Ted Parker Mobile Homes back in its heyday.
What Wright calls a shortage of stick-built homes in today’s climate has only helped him and his staff reach sales goals throughout the Carolinas.
“We’re killing it,” he said earlier this week of the Lumberton site. “It’s booming. It’s good. Mobile homes are like food. You’ve got to have it. Especially in the South. Look at how many mobile homes are in Robeson County. Customers have no choice. The stick-built home business has gotten so high. It’s difficult for a common person who can afford $353,000 for a regular home.”
The home shortage, Wright surmised, is due to contractors not being able to acquire the materials that they need in the building industry.
His business specializes in manufactured and modular homes.
As a result, he said, “I just think the average middle class worker – that is what he has to do. I don’t think he has a choice. This latest generation don’t want to wait for nothing. They can wait six to 10 months for a stick-built or buy something off my lot that will take about six weeks to set up.”
Marty Wright Home Sales, he said, sells in excess of $50 million worth of mobile homes a year.
If mobile home sales weren’t on an uptick, Wright said, “I wouldn’t have invested all that money in Lumberton. It takes a lot of money to build a dealership.”
Besides Lumberton, Wright owns and operates mobile home businesses in Chadbourn and Laurel Hill in North Carolina. Further south, in South Carolina, he has operations based in Bennettsville, Pageland, Florence and Anderson.
The Anderson site ranks an overall No. 1 in sales in the Carolinas, Wright said, and an overall No. 7 across the United States.
His father is a retired Baptist minister who once preached the rewards of having God in one’s life; Marty Wright, his son, is a born salesman who espouses the benefits of manufactured and modular homes, an affordable option to prospective homeowners to realize their dream of building a custom home.
“Marty Wright Home Sales … is dedicated to making the goal of homeownership a reality for our customers,” the business states on its Chadbourn website. “Our sales team strives to provide the best customer service and overall home buying experience for each and every one of our customers. Purchasing a home is a huge milestone, and we want to make sure that everyone is comfortable and confident.”
Wright has been involved in the business for 34 years. In 1989, he started working in the industry for mobile-home magnate Ted Parker, whose now-defunct business was based in Lumberton.
He said it was Victor Brewington, whom he referred to as the former superstar for Ted Parker Homes, who approached him about opening a location in Lumberton.
Brewington now serves as general manager of the new Lumberton mobile home park.
So why here?
Why Lumberton?
“Lumberton is the No. 1 mobile home market in North Carolina, by far. Not even close. Not a close second,” Wright said. “We’ll dominate the state of North Carolina with that Lumberton store.”
As for how his business differs from other home sales operations, Wright didn’t skip a beat. “I’m a working owner,” he said. “I’m the largest independent dealer in the southeastern United States.”
“Tell the dang truth. Do what you say. Fix ‘em when they tear up,” he replied, when asked the key to a successful mobile home sales enterprise. “Again, I’m a working owner. Most guys who have been in it as long as me don’t work. They don’t talk to customers. They’re too good for that. I’m a multimillionaire who hit the ground running.”

author: @Sean Ford
title: Avebury Nickel Mine survival optimism | The Advocate | Burnie, TAS
text: The Avebury Nickel Mine is still buying equipment amid optimism it will continue to operate under a new owner, saving about 200 West Coast jobs. Mine owner Mallee Resources Limited went into administration and later into receivership this year after running into debt problems. [The mine was put on the market](https://www.theadvocate.com.au/story/8442794/china-shows-interest-in-avebury-nickel-mine-sale/) as a going concern, with receiver KordaMentha aiming to have the sale process complete before Christmas. That goal appears to have been missed, but subsequent comments from mine general manager John Lamb on social media suggested a sale might well be close. Thanking people for their best wishes for his December 25 birthday, Mr Lamb gave special thanks to the Avebury team. "2023, to quote HM Queen Elizabeth II, is not a year on which we will look back with undiluted pleasure," Mr Lamb wrote on LinkedIn. "Nonetheless, Team Avebury did not give up, and the mine has continued to operate safely and productively throughout the difficult times. "In recent weeks, we have added another new drill (Simba E7C) to the fleet, plus four new trucks. "Now we're looking forward to completion of the sale process and to welcoming our new owner." Mr Lamb said the team was ready to get to work and had a lot to do. Further detail on the situation was being sought from Mr Lamb at the time of writing. It is understood there has been a significant level of interest from potential buyers. Mallee resumed production at the mine last year after more than a decade of care and maintenance under various owners. Sign up for our newsletter to stay up to date. We care about the protection of your data. Read our [Privacy Policy](/privacy/).

author: www.lemanbleu.ch, Léman Bleu Télévision
title: Le stress et l'épuisement au travail « toujours plus alarmant »
text:
Le stress et l'épuisement au travail « toujours plus alarmant »
Un tiers des employés sondés par Travail.Suisse se disent "très souvent" épuisées après une journée de travail (image d'illustration).
Photo: KEYSTONE/CHRISTIAN BEUTLERLe stress et l'épuisement des travailleurs atteint 'un niveau toujours plus alarmant', selon Travail.Suisse. Six travailleurs sur sept (84,2%) sont parfois trop exténués, après une journée de travail, pour s'occuper encore de leurs affaires personnelles ou familiales.
Pour un bon tiers des gens, c'est même 'souvent' voire 'très souvent' le cas, un record, alerte le syndicat qui a présenté vendredi son Baromètre annuel sur les conditions de travail. Pour sa vice-présidente Léonore Porchet, la lutte contre le stress doit devenir 'une priorité absolue', tant pour des raisons de protection de la santé que pour le bien de l'économie nationale.
Plus de 770'000 employés songent en effet à changer de travail l'année prochaine en raison du stress subi.
Le Baromètre pointe également du doigt les désavantages subis en raison de limitations dues à l'état de santé. Plus des deux tiers des personnes souffrant de maladies chroniques et limitées dans leur travail ne bénéficient d'aucun aménagement de leur activité ou de leur poste de travail, critique Travail.Suisse.
/ATS
